technicalSpec.title: How to create a Technical Specification for Automation
technicalSpec.subtitle: AutoFina provides access to automation and custom scripts. By purchasing a script, you agree to the conditions below. Violation of rules — loss of support without compensation.

section1.title: Project Idea
section1.content1: Describe the script's purpose: what it should automate on the web (clicks, data entry, navigation, data collection).
section1.content2: Example: automatic token claiming on a project website with logging of all steps.
section1.content3: If there are references or similar solutions — add links.

item1.title: Main Actions
item1.content: List the main actions in the interface: authorization, button clicks, form filling, captcha bypass, retry attempts.

item2.title: Configuration Flexibility
item2.content: Specify preferences for configuration flexibility: ability to change network, timings, limits, wallet list without code changes.

section3.title: Integrations and Access

item1.title: Wallets and Networks
item1.content: Specify which wallets/networks will be used (MetaMask, OKX, Rabby, etc.).

item2.title: API Keys and Tokens
item2.content: If API keys, tokens, or private endpoints are needed — prepare them in advance.

section3.example: Example: «script interacts with the site through Owlto (EVM) for transaction confirmation».

section4.title: Data Storage
section4.content: Determine where to store the work results: Database or Google Sheets.
section4.example: Example: «each successful action is recorded in Google Sheets with date, wallet, and status».

section5.title: Deadline and Budget
section5.content: Specify the desired delivery date and possible budget.
section5.example: Example: deadline — 7 days, budget — up to $300.
section5.tip: If deadlines are critical — mark this separately.

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.subtitle: Please read our terms and conditions before proceeding with your order

section1.title: Agreement Overview
section1.content1: By submitting your order, you agree to these terms and conditions. This agreement governs the relationship between you (the client) and AutoFina (the service provider).
section1.content2: These terms apply to all services provided by AutoFina, including but not limited to automation solutions, web development, and consulting services.

item1.title: Project Scope
item1.content: The scope of work is defined in the technical specification provided by the client. Any changes to the scope may result in additional costs and timeline adjustments.

item2.title: Timeline and Delivery
item2.content: Project timelines are estimates based on the provided requirements. Delays may occur due to scope changes, technical complexity, or client feedback cycles.

item3.title: Payment Terms
item3.content: Payment is due according to the agreed schedule. We accept bank transfers and cryptocurrency payments. Late payments may incur additional fees.

item1.title: Client Rights
item1.content: Upon full payment, the client receives full ownership of the delivered code and documentation, excluding third-party libraries and frameworks.

item2.title: Confidentiality
item2.content: We maintain strict confidentiality regarding your project details and business information. All communications and project data are protected under NDA.

section4.title: Support and Warranty
section4.content: We provide 30 days of free support for bug fixes and minor adjustments after project delivery. Major feature changes are not included in the warranty period.
section4.contact: For questions about these terms, contact us via Telegram or email.
